channel.title: What are the benifits to using Notepad++ over Notepad?
channel.description: The title says it all. Please don't say, "Use Eclipse." I find Eclipse very non-user-friendly and it is very slow in loading up.

item.title: What are the benifits to using Notepad++ over Notepad?

item.description:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Notepad++#Features

item.title: What are the benifits to using Notepad++ over Notepad?
item.dc:creator: @arean arean
item.description:
@arean wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:29, topic:543469”][quote author=arean link=topic=662349.msg4427384#msg4427384 date=1401483393]

You attitude honestly makes me wonder… how did you treat your players?

I am not a child. I know how to run a sucessful server as well as earning good profit from my donators, plus I would say I can code to save my life. Something most of the people here can’t do and if you say you can, you’re just bsing yourself because most people only pretend to be able to code, aswell as hosting a server which its only future is to get DDoSed and fudged by blitzbots.

I would love to see some examples of your code.

Here’s a great example of this kid’s skill:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,661774

Someone is mad. As long as I obtain the attributes to run a server that holds more players than the amount of months you’ve not lost your virginity enables I to dominate you in every way young man. Keep trying though.
[/quote]
Lol. You wouldn’t be worth getting mad over. Hell, you wouldn’t even be worth feeling bad for.
You can keep trying to attack me with your petty insults about me and my skill or whatever. I’ll gladly sit here and watch you dig a deeper hole for yourself.[/quote]

Cool story broski. Get back to your fail pre-eoc remakes. I’m sure you’ll pay someone to come and DDoS your server so you feel like somebody even cares about your shiet.

Read full topic

item.title: What are the benifits to using Notepad++ over Notepad?
item.dc:creator: @mr_arrows95 bansil
item.description:
@mr_arrows95 wrote:

I personally use Notepad ++ Because it formats code according to what language you’re writing in.

I also use it because of the syntax highlighting which is oh-so sexy.

Read full topic
item.source: What are the benifits to using Notepad++ over Notepad?

item.title: What are the benifits to using Notepad++ over Notepad?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Why hate on the OP?
You know he’s stupid when he said he finds eclipse not user friendly. We know that leeched a server coding in notepad, paying developers and making help threads.

People should learn to accept that and more on.

OT: The benefits are quiet clear. Notepad is a text editor with like 1 feature which will never be used more then once (changing the font size and type). Notepad++ has a ton of buttons, syntax highlighting, console, tabbed pages and more. Seriously does not take a genius to make a direct visual comparison.

Memory wise Notepad++ is still small in usage and disk space.

I see no point to this thread.

Read full topic

item.title: What are the benifits to using Notepad++ over Notepad?
item.dc:creator: @arean arean
item.description:
@arean wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:16, topic:543469”][quote author=arean link=topic=662349.msg4427231#msg4427231 date=1401409061]

What’s the benefits? You’ve clearly never opened a .java file in notepad++.
Or an IDE.

And you clearly have never maintained a server that has reached more than 4 players you wannabe-mod. Just answer the damn question or gtfo my thread.

You’re a fool.

95% of the “benefit” that Notepad++ gives you is visual. You know what that means? You have to look at it to see the differences.

Edit: Also, you’re asking a general programming question that doesn’t have to do with hosting a rsps… So how ever many players I have had on a rsps literally means nothing, and the fact that you brought it up means that you were either defending yourself or trying to show some form of superiority over me.

And you my good sir, are a fagit.

How many players you have on a server means EVERYTHING. It doesn’t matter if you are some pretending “pro” coder trying to act like you know anything and still get like 2 active players. It ultimately matters if you have the playerbase as playerbase over-rules all. If nobody plays your fail server then you HAVE FAILED… So next time you speak, get more than 4 people playing a server you make.

How the hell does playerbase have anything to do with what he said…?

Because when I see these people trying to act like they are some pro coder who looks down on everyone else is stupid. Most of these fudge-cakes just say a bunch of crap on here but never actually prove their server to be anything. If they actually had a fully sucessful server and being a great coder too then you can’t really question what they say. But I know for a fact that most of these idiots can’t even hold 3 players in 3 weeks. I’m not one to boast but atleast my server is semi-sucessful and actually has 40-50 active players on everyday and its only a Delta which I have heavily edited to my needs. Its just stupid for these idiots to easily judge people like me despite whatever they make to be equivilent to some shiet on the floor.

Rant over, I got the info I need.
[/quote]
Saying “I’m not one to boast” and then boasting, just goes to show that I was right:

Edit: Also, you’re asking a general programming question that doesn’t have to do with hosting a rsps… So how ever many players I have had on a rsps literally means nothing, and the fact that you brought it up means that you were either defending yourself or trying to show some form of superiority over me.

No one mentioned their own personal serve until you did. You keep saying how [u]your server is better[/b] but at the same time that you don’t boast. Stop being an idiot.

Its just stupid for these idiots to easily judge people like me despite whatever they make to be equivilent to some shiet on the floor.

You’re the one judging me when you don’t even know how to google.[/quote]

LOL are you listening to yourself faggy-foo? Nothing you say on this forum will ever be right until you make something sucessful you try-hard wannabe. Keep trying with your fail servers, maybe one day you’ll get 5 players?

Read full topic

item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Dan0194, post:11, topic:543469”][quote author=arean link=topic=662349.msg4427182#msg4427182 date=1401399942]

What’s the benefits? You’ve clearly never opened a .java file in notepad++.
Or an IDE.

And you clearly have never maintained a server that has reached more than 4 players you wannabe-mod. Just answer the damn question or gtfo my thread.

You’re a fool.

95% of the “benefit” that Notepad++ gives you is visual. You know what that means? You have to look at it to see the differences.

Edit: Also, you’re asking a general programming question that doesn’t have to do with hosting a rsps… So how ever many players I have had on a rsps literally means nothing, and the fact that you brought it up means that you were either defending yourself or trying to show some form of superiority over me.

And you my good sir, are a fagit.

How many players you have on a server means EVERYTHING. It doesn’t matter if you are some pretending “pro” coder trying to act like you know anything and still get like 2 active players. It ultimately matters if you have the playerbase as playerbase over-rules all. If nobody plays your fail server then you HAVE FAILED… So next time you speak, get more than 4 people playing a server you make.
[/quote]

Lol are you stupid? Your basing someone’s programming skills on the amount of players they get on their server. Look at some of the servers out there that get 300 people most of them are leeched PI shit. Ask any successful programmer 95% use an IDE to program. Sk8rdude is right the only benefit from notepad to notepad++ is the visual and maybe it shows the line numbers with a few other features also.[/quote]

This thread (and especially your post) is so damn cringe-worthy. OP is a successful troll.

sk8rdude461:

item.title: What are the benifits to using Notepad++ over Notepad?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arean, post:10, topic:543469”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=662349.msg4427149#msg4427149 date=1401391954]

What’s the benefits? You’ve clearly never opened a .java file in notepad++.
Or an IDE.

And you clearly have never maintained a server that has reached more than 4 players you wannabe-mod. Just answer the damn question or gtfo my thread.

You’re a fool.

95% of the “benefit” that Notepad++ gives you is visual. You know what that means? You have to look at it to see the differences.

Edit: Also, you’re asking a general programming question that doesn’t have to do with hosting a rsps… So how ever many players I have had on a rsps literally means nothing, and the fact that you brought it up means that you were either defending yourself or trying to show some form of superiority over me.
[/quote]
And you my good sir, are a fagit.

How many players you have on a server means EVERYTHING. It doesn’t matter if you are some pretending “pro” coder trying to act like you know anything and still get like 2 active players. It ultimately matters if you have the playerbase as playerbase over-rules all. If nobody plays your fail server then you HAVE FAILED… So next time you speak, get more than 4 people playing a server you make.[/quote]
No, it means nothing here. We’re not talking about your server. We’re talking about a rich text editor over a standard text editor.
If we were comparing my server to your server, then player count would be a factor. You have no knowledge of my previous servers player counts, as most of them were never hosted live. My current team (see my signature) isn’t hosting our server until we add more content.

[quote=“Notepad-plus-plus”]Features
Syntax Highlighting and Syntax Folding
User Defined Syntax Highlighting and Folding: screenshot 1, screenshot 2, screenshot 3 and screenshot 4
PCRE (Perl Compatible Regular Expression) Search/Replace
GUI entirely customizable: minimalist, tab with close button, multi-line tab, vertical tab and vertical document list
Document Map
Auto-completion: Word completion, Function completion and Function parameters hint
Multi-Document (Tab interface)
Multi-View
WYSIWYG (Printing)
Zoom in and zoom out
Multi-Language environment supported
Bookmark
Macro recording and playback
Launch with different arguments[/quote]
There are your benefits.

Read full topic
item.source: What are the benifits to using Notepad++ over Notepad?

item.dc:creator: @arean arean
item.description:
@arean wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:543469”][quote author=arean link=topic=662349.msg4427137#msg4427137 date=1401389712]

What’s the benefits? You’ve clearly never opened a .java file in notepad++.
Or an IDE.

And you clearly have never maintained a server that has reached more than 4 players you wannabe-mod. Just answer the damn question or gtfo my thread.
[/quote]
You’re a fool.

95% of the “benefit” that Notepad++ gives you is visual. You know what that means? You have to look at it to see the differences.

Edit: Also, you’re asking a general programming question that doesn’t have to do with hosting a rsps… So how ever many players I have had on a rsps literally means nothing, and the fact that you brought it up means that you were either defending yourself or trying to show some form of superiority over me.[/quote]
And you my good sir, are a fagit.

How many players you have on a server means EVERYTHING. It doesn’t matter if you are some pretending “pro” coder trying to act like you know anything and still get like 2 active players. It ultimately matters if you have the playerbase as playerbase over-rules all. If nobody plays your fail server then you HAVE FAILED… So next time you speak, get more than 4 people playing a server you make.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

if eclipse is too bulky for you use netbeans. you aren’t going to get anywhere programming in notepad/notepad++

I’m not just saying it to piss you off, I’m talking from experience. I spent pretty much 2010-2012 programming in notepad and it got me nowhere. I spent weeks packaging a server when I could have done it in 5 minutes using eclipse lol
